snippet: The effort to confront cholera in Haiti was muddled by the United Nations’ apparent role in setting it off.
abstract: Cholera has killed more than 7,050 Haitians and sickened more than 531,000 since the first case was reported in 2010; world has rallied to confront cholera, but the mission has been muddled by the United Nations' apparent role in igniting the epidemic and its unwillingness to acknowledge it; epidemiologic and microbiologic evidence strongly suggests that United Nations peacekeeping troops from Nepal imported cholera to Haiti and contaminated the river tributary next to their base through a faulty sanitation system.

byline.contributor: André Paultre contributed reporting from Port-au-Prince, Haiti.

lead_paragraph: The effort to confront cholera in Haiti was muddled by the United Nations’ apparent role in setting it off.

headline.seo: Haiti’s Cholera Outraced the Experts and Tainted the U.N.
headline.main: In Haiti, Global Failures on a Cholera Epidemic
headline.print_headline: Global Failures on a Haitian Epidemic
